DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A reduction in the number of blood cells._A disorder resulting from loss of function or tissue destruction of an organ or multiple organs, arising from humoral or cellular immune responses of the individual to his own tissue constituents.  It may be systemic (e.g., systemic lupus erythematosus), or organ specific, (e.g., thyroiditis). -- 2003_Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned._A method of generalization, the systematic arrangement of entities into classes or groups based on mutual similarity and certain differing characteristics.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A reduction in the number of blood cells.:A condition in which the body recognizes its own tissues as foreign and directs an immune response against them.

Concepts.definition: A laboratory test result indicating an abnormally low quantity of circulating blood cells.

A disorder resulting from loss of function or tissue destruction of an organ or multiple organs, arising from humoral or cellular immune responses of the individual to his own tissue constituents. It may be systemic (e.g., systemic lupus erythematosus), or organ specific, (e.g., thyroiditis).
